channel.title: Remove the "You may only post once" limit
channel.description: Originally, if you post, you cannot post again until someone else posts. Truth be told, it's useless. It really makes it hard on project threads. Maybe we could remove it entirely or remove it from the projects and advertisement sections?

item.title: Remove the "You may only post once" limit
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

If that plan doesn’t work, why not create a modification that allows someone to bump a topic (the administration can set a time when the member can bump the topic again) and it counts down until they can bump the topic again? IPB has this and I’ve used the modification and it works wonders when I used IPB.

item.title: Remove the "You may only post once" limit
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:4, topic:533759”][quote author=runescape sucks link=topic=652554.msg4372419#msg4372419 date=1381077445]
No no no, not from the advertisements section. Too many people would keep bumping their topic to first.
[/quote]

With the old system it did not bump your topic. If you double posted it would just edit your last post with a line through it to separate them. Not sure why we cant just have that again.

I don’t want to see any BUMP posts where the server advertisement section becomes a bumping war. But if you have a legit reason to bump your thread in the server advertisements, such as an important update, simply copy your last post, delete it, then repost it with your edit. No one’s going to have a problem with that, but it better be worthwhile and do not abuse it.[/quote]
I was referring to bringing back that old system. It was really convenient.

Read full topic
